definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to send/to devote/to deliver/to cause/to convey

sentences.english: Today, the most rich road to riches are among our most popular thing.
sentences.chinese: 今天，最發財致富之道都在我們最常用的東西之中。

sentences.english: Mr. Shaw made his fortune in the ring and on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 蕭先生在拳擊以及華爾街投資中發財致富。

sentences.english: My ambition is to make money and retire young.
sentences.chinese: 我的志向是發財致富，年輕時就退休。

sentences.english: Sutter was a Swiss. He had gone to America some years earlier to make his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 薩特是一位瑞士人，幾年前他爲了發財致富到了美國。

sentences.english: The next morning he was to start for the west to make his fortune.
sentences.chinese: 他計劃第二天早上動身到西部去發財致富。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
